topic: Infrastructure and Development with Economic Considerations

ideas.title: Level Crossing Labyrinth
ideas.premise: A family trying to navigate the ever-shifting detours of the Cranbourne line level crossing works using a comically oversized, outdated Melways.
ideas.why_funny: Relatable frustration with never-ending roadworks and reliance on obsolete technology.

ideas.title: E-Scooter Serengeti
ideas.premise: A David Attenborough-esque narrator describes a bustling Melbourne CBD streetscape as an 'E-Scooter Serengeti', complete with territorial disputes over charging docks.
ideas.why_funny: Parodying nature documentaries highlights the absurdity of e-scooter chaos.

ideas.title: Arts Precinct Archaeology
ideas.premise: Construction workers on the Arts Precinct development unearth an ancient 'latte' from 1990s Melbourne, sparking an archaeological debate about its cultural significance.
ideas.why_funny: Pokes fun at Melbourne's coffee obsession and questions about heritage.

ideas.title: Storm Surge Economics
ideas.premise: A graph charting Melbourne Storm's Grand Final success perfectly mirrors Victoria's renewable energy funding graph, implying a direct causal link.
ideas.why_funny: Absurd correlation is humorous, leveraging Melbourne's sports culture.

ideas.title: Latrobe Valley Sun
ideas.premise: A tourist brochure showcases the Latrobe Valley's new renewable energy projects, with the sun wearing sunglasses and a tiny wind turbine saying, 'Finally, a tan!'
ideas.why_funny: Visual pun linking solar power and tanning; humorous personification of nature.
